title: Three shorts on architecture
creator_contributor_role: New Zealand National Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport/High-rise apartment buildings - Social aspects
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Buildings - Conservation and restoration
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Housing - Social aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/High-rise apartment buildings - Social aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/City planning - Social aspects
description: 1. "Some Elements of Architecture." A no-commentary interlude of stone, wood and brick; patterns and colours, enclosed spaces, and people. 2. "Ways of Looking at Buildings." Comments from assorted people upon high-rise and other buildings, old and new. 3. "Anxiety and Alternative." Suggestions for new ways of preserving the uniqueness of our place, while building for our future. A comprehensive examination of New Zealand architecture - past, present and possible future.
